definition: chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: So what we can do is first and foremost, raise money.
sentences.chinese: 而現在我們首要任務就是籌錢。

sentences.english: Du chopped the losing responsibility to jade lute, forced jade lute to raise money to pay his debts.
sentences.chinese: 杜茸把輸錢的責任推到玉琴身上，迫玉琴籌錢還債。

sentences.english: Because of her travelling expenses and lack of food, she came to the gate to sing for money.
sentences.chinese: 由於缺少路費，又沒有喫的，她就到雍門唱歌籌錢。

sentences.english: At the same time, Tsvangirai is trying to raise money for basic reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 同時特斯凡基萊還在爲基本建設籌錢。

sentences.english: The Chinese had a lottery over 2000 years ago to raise money to build the Great Wall.
sentences.chinese: 中國在2000年前就用彩票來籌錢修建長城。

sentences.english: The point is, though, that she was selling these tidbits to raise money for her passion.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵是，她正在賣小食品來爲她的信仰籌錢。

sentences.english: The theater department raised money to buy new curtains for the stage.
sentences.chinese: 戲劇系籌錢購買舞臺的新幕布。

sentences.english: I plan to busk in some busy streets to make the money I need for the travel.
sentences.chinese: 我計劃在一些繁華的路段進行街頭表演，籌錢去旅行。

sentences.english: Small talk about love and Zhou Baomin raise money keep children decided to sell the furniture store.
sentences.chinese: 談小愛和周寶民決定賣掉傢俱店籌錢保住孩子。

definition: to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
